definition: to run away/to take to one's heels
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: “Where the broom does not reach”, he said, “the dust will not vanish of itself.”
sentences.chinese: “笤帚不到”，他說，“灰塵不會自己跑掉。”

sentences.english: And if customers do not get what they want, they defect.
sentences.chinese: 如果顧客得不到他們想要的服務，他們就會跑掉。

sentences.english: That may be true, but I can tell you that I won’t look the other way or run the other way like those cowards.
sentences.chinese: 也許會這樣，但我絕不會像那些懦夫一樣跑掉。

sentences.english: Lin Pingzhi picked up cassock secretly run away quickly.
sentences.chinese: 林平之撿了袈裟趕緊偷偷跑掉。

sentences.english: The deer got wind of the hunter and run off .
sentences.chinese: 鹿察知獵者的氣味便跑掉了。

sentences.english: Close the gate of the pen properly to prevent the sheep from getting away.
sentences.chinese: 把羊圈關好，防備羊羣跑掉。

sentences.english: When your birthday passed and I didn’t call
sentences.chinese: 整晚想着你生日那天，我跑掉了，電話也不給。

sentences.english: He has hauled off before I go by him.
sentences.chinese: 沒等我靠近他，他就跑掉了。

sentences.english: Wind your line in very carefully or the fish might get away.
sentences.chinese: 小心收線，否則魚會跑掉。

sentences.english: She hoicked out the door and ran away.
Wind your line carefully or the fish might get away.
sentences.chinese: 小心收線，否則魚會跑掉。

sentences.english: When facing many enemies out for blood, it is best to run.
sentences.chinese: 面對衆多窮兇極惡的敵人時，最好能跑掉。

sentences.english: She backed off and then turned and ran.
sentences.chinese: 她退向後面然後轉身跑掉了。

sentences.english: The deer got wind of the hunter and ran off .
sentences.chinese: 鹿察知獵者的氣味便跑掉了。

sentences.english: Have they run?' asked Mr Smollett.
sentences.chinese: “他們跑掉了嗎？”斯莫列特先生問道。

sentences.english: He took out when he was badly needed.
sentences.chinese: 在非常需要他的時候他卻跑掉了。

definition: to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to leave in stealth/to slip away
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
(dialect) to rush off/to scamper off double-quick/to take to one's heels/to make oneself scarce
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
